subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[lush]]; [[luxuriant]]; [[exuberant]]; [[dense]]; [[thick]]
# [[various]]; [[abundant]]; [[profuse]]
# [[deep]]; [[obscure]]; [[profound]]
# to [[gather]]; to [[stagnate]]; to become [[stagnant]]
# [[depressed]]; [[gloomy]]; [[moody]]
# [[melancholy]]; [[depression]]
# to [[begrudge]]; to [[resent]]; to feel [[aggrieved]]
# [[hot]] [[air]] ([[rising]]); [[steam]]
# a kind of [[plum]]
# [[name]] of a [[god]]
# [[tall]] and [[big]]
# [[putrid]]; [[putrefied]]
# [[tulip]]; [[fragrant]] [[grass]]
#: {{zh-alt-inline|𩰪|䖇}}
# {{zh-div|水}} [[name]] for a [[branch]] of the [[Pearl River]], including the {{w|You River (Guangxi)|You River}}, {{w|Yu River (Guangxi)|Yu River}} and the {{w|Xun River}} in [[Guangxi]], as well as the {{w|Xi River}} [[downstream]] in [[Guangdong]]
# {{zh-div|郡}} [[name]] of an [[ancient]] [[Chinese]] [[prefecture]]
# {{surname|lang=zh}}

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Trivia
subSections.text: 鬱 has, at 29 strokes, the most strokes of any kanji in the jōyō kanji list or {{w|kanji kentei}} level pre-1.<ref>[http://nihonshock.com/2009/10/crazy-kanji-highest-stroke-count/ Crazy kanji: what’s the highest stroke count?], Nihonshock, 2009 Oct 22</ref> The next highest kanji in the jōyō list is [[鑑]], at 23 strokes.
